result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Victor Sanchez was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse program afer serving one half (1/2) Initial Confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: If revoked, all conditions of probation to convert to conditions of Extended Supervision. Exception is the condition time.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered INtoxicated Driver Assessment form filed.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge within term of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.  
If revoked, to be collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison wages.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid,  a civil judgment to be entered.

Submit DNA sample if not already done. 
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated. Order signed and filed.

No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.  
No contact with drug community.
Alcohol and drug assessment.   Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens. No positive results.

timeConds.notes:
Huber release for work and treatment.  No good time credit to apply.
***November 7, 2014, Judge William Pocan..DECISIOIN & ORDFR/GOOD TIME CREDIT to apply to this sentence***

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order Granting Request for Good Time signed and filed.  Notice to parties.  alp
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for good time credit.
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Victor Sanchez in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant still qualifies for PD representation.    
On State's motion, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED.   As to COUNT 1:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense and defendant.  Tyrone St. Junior appears for the State of Wisconsin.   

Court sentenced defendant to pay a FINE of $2,400.00 PLUS all costs, penalties and surcharges within term of probation or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.  If revoked, to be collected by the DOC out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.
Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for 24 months.
Court ordered ignition interlock for 12 months, consecutive to revocation.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 4 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 0 days 
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.
  
 The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3
years with the following conditions:

*Serve condition time of 10 months in the HOC, Huber release for work and treatment.  No good time credit to apply.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.  
- Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.  If revoked, to be collected by the DOC out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- If revoked, defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1/2 initial confinement.
**If revoked, all conditions of probation to convert to conditions of ES.  

Appeal rights given.
Violation Report received and filed with court.

WCS report addressed; defendant not in compliance with conditions of monitoring.  Court denies State's request for modification of bail.  Defendant admonished that further violations shall result in possible cash bail.

Defendant Victor Sanchez in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor
informs court that defendant may no longer qualify for PD representation and intends to retain private counsel.  Defendant directed to return to the PD's office to see if he qualifies.  Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

14RM029373  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/10/2014

Attorney Valeria L Taylor in court, defendant Victor Sanchez not in court, in custody-Waukesha.  Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders other terms and conditions of bail to remain the same.
Court also orders no possession of use of controlled substance without a valid prescription.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail AMENDED  $500 CASH.

Defendant Victor Sanchez in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Defendant Victor Sanchez in custody.  Sara Schroeder for Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS for supervision if they are eligible for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug test, portable breathalyzers and SCRAM.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances  (no alcohol) without a valid prescription. 
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Victor Sanchez in court with student intern Trish Fritz under the student practice rule supervised by attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Victor Sanchez in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
